channel.title: RS500.blog
channel.description: Blogging the 500 Greatest Albums of All Time

item.title: Here Come The Warm Jets
item.description: Thoughts about the 'Here Come The Warm Jets' album, by Brian Eno, released in 1975 and ranked at #432.

item.title: All Things Must Pass
item.description: Thoughts about the 'All Things Must Pass' album, by George Harrison, released in 1970 and ranked at #433.

item.title: #1 Record
item.description: Thoughts about the '#1 Record' album, by Big Star, released in 1972 and ranked at #434.

item.title: In Utero
item.description: Thoughts about the 'In Utero' album, by Nirvana, released in 1993 and ranked at #435.

item.title: Sea Change
item.description: Thoughts about the 'Sea Change' album, by Beck, released in 2002 and ranked at #436.

item.title: Tha Carter III
item.description: Thoughts about the 'Tha Carter III' album, by Lil Wayne, released in 2008 and ranked at #437.

item.title: Boys Don't Cry
item.description: Thoughts about the 'Boys Don't Cry' album, by The Cure, released in 1980 and ranked at #438.

item.title: Live at the Harlem Square Club, 1963
item.description: Thoughts about the 'Live at the Harlem Square Club, 1963' album, by Sam Cooke, released in 1963 and ranked at #439.

item.title: Rum Sodomy and the Lash
item.description: Thoughts about the 'Rum Sodomy and the Lash' album, by The Pogues, released in 1985 and ranked at #440.

item.title: Suicide
item.description: Thoughts about the 'Suicide' album, by Suicide, released in 1977 and ranked at #441.
